item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, August 29, 2024 at 1:05 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Judge dismisses majority of GitHub Copilot copyright claims (86 points | 61 comments)
2. Twenty Years of Valgrind (2022) (152 points | 25 comments)
3. Maker Skill Trees (202 points | 55 comments)
4. Window Maker: X11 window manager with the look and feel of the NeXTSTEP UI (146 points | 80 comments)
5. The Future of TLA+ [pdf] (127 points | 43 comments)
6. Show HN: Skip – Build native iOS and Android apps from a single Swift codebase (107 points | 33 comments)
7. Kotlin for Data Analysis (91 points | 27 comments)
8. Google's New Pipe Syntax in SQL (89 points | 35 comments)
9. Show HN: Repo2vec – an open-source library for chatting with any codebase (48 points | 32 comments)
10. Scaling Rails and Postgres to Users at Microsoft: Lessons and Takeaways (79 points | 6 comments)
11. The journey of an internet packet: Exploring networks with traceroute (302 points | 103 comments)
12. The 4-chan Go programmer (202 points | 101 comments)
13. What Is Post-Quantum Cryptography? – NIST (22 points | 18 comments)
14. Charge Robotics (YC S21) is hiring MechEs to build robots that build solar farms ( | hide)
15. Panasonic Toughbook 40 (103 points | 105 comments)
16. Show HN: IPA, a GUI for exploring inner details of PDFs (208 points | 40 comments)
17. A dishwasher can make or break a restaurant (2017) (210 points | 390 comments)
18. Formal CHERI: design-time proof of full-scale architecture security properties (2022) (95 points | 28 comments)
19. Typing lists and tuples in Elixir (181 points | 44 comments)
20. "Everything" is a filename search engine for Windows (134 points | 82 comments)
21. What's New in SQLAlchemy 2.1? (4 points | discuss)
22. A Post by Guido van Rossum Removed for Violating Python Community Guidelines (105 points | 60 comments)
23. High-temperature Gibbs states are unentangled and efficiently preparable (53 points | 15 comments)
24. Show HN: Claude Artifacts but creating real web apps (79 points | 23 comments)
25. Diffusion models are real-time game engines (1016 points | 374 comments)
26. Telegram boss banned from leaving France in criminal probe (18 points | 8 comments)
27. Companies Lobby Against Giving the Military the Right to Repair (94 points | 55 comments)
28. Microsoft donates the Mono Project to the Wine team (1331 points | 451 comments)
29. Show HN: Shed Light on Your Go Binary Bloat with Go Size Analyzer (59 points | 7 comments)
30. Boxxy puts bad Linux applications in a box with only their files (143 points | 91 comments)
